(Pulcher.) We could not enter that city, for the Emperor, fear* ing that possibly we would do some damage to him, did not wish to let us. So it was necessary that we buy our daily supplies out- side the walls. These, by the order of the Emperor, the citizens brought to us. We were not allowed to enter the city many at a time. ¹Only five or six per hour were permitted; thus, while some were leaving, others were then entering to pray in the churches.
